dice.program

Interface Scope

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Block, Function, Program

    public interface Scope

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Function getFunction(java.lang.String name, int line)
      Gets the named function in scope.
      int getVariable(java.lang.String name, int line)
      Gets the value of the specified variable in the current scope.
      boolean hasVariable(java.lang.String name)
      Checks if this scope, or the parent scopes contain this variable.
      void setParentScope(Scope parent)
      Sets the given Scope as the parent of this.
      void setVariable(java.lang.String name, int val)
      Changes the value of the named variable.

    • Method Detail

      • getVariable

        int getVariable(java.lang.String name,
                int line)
         throws UndefinedVariableException
        Gets the value of the specified variable in the current scope. If it is not in the current scope, then it checks the parent scope.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the variable
        line - the current line of this program (only needed in case of error)
        Returns:
        the value of the named variable
        Throws:
        UndefinedVariableException - if the variable is not defined in this scope, or any parent scope

      • setVariable

        void setVariable(java.lang.String name,
                 int val)
        Changes the value of the named variable. This first checks for the nearest scope that already contains the variable, then changes its value there. If the variable doesn't exist in this scope, then it is created locally.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the variable
        val - the new value for the variable

      • hasVariable

        boolean hasVariable(java.lang.String name)
        Checks if this scope, or the parent scopes contain this variable.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the variable
        Returns:
        true if the variable exists in scope

      • getFunction

        Function getFunction(java.lang.String name,
                     int line)
              throws UndefinedFunctionException
        Gets the named function in scope.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the function
        line - the current line of this program (only needed in case of error)
        Returns:
        the named Function
        Throws:
        UndefinedFunctionException - if the function was not declared in scope

      • setParentScope

        void setParentScope(Scope parent)
        Sets the given Scope as the parent of this.
        Parameters:
        parent - the new parent of this
